Basal cell carcinoma: Surgical excision, Mohs micrographic surgery, or topical imiquimod
Benign keratosis-like lesions: Observation or cryotherapy if symptomatic or for cosmetic reasons
Dermatofibroma: No treatment necessary unless symptomatic, then excision
Melanocytic nevi: Monitoring for changes, excision if suspicious or for cosmetic reasons
Melanoma: Surgical excision with clear margins, immunotherapy, or targeted therapy
Vascular lesions: Laser therapy, sclerotherapy, or observation depending on lesion type
